work.position: Senior Engineering Manager | Frontend Software Architect
highlights: Lead a team of 9 full-stack engineers building scalable web applications for boutique fitness studios, delivering seamless experiences across scheduling, payments, and client management
Drive frontend architecture strategy including microfrontend adoption, enabling independent team deployments and faster iteration cycles
Architect and implement AI-native features and conversational interfaces, integrating LLM capabilities into production workflows
Partner with Product, Design, and executive leadership to translate business objectives into technical roadmaps, balancing feature delivery with platform stability
Champion frontend best practices including accessibility (WCAG), design system consistency, and performance optimization
Mentor engineers at all levels, conduct architecture reviews, and foster a culture of technical excellence and ownership
Spearheaded frontend architecture improvements, transitioning legacy Ember.js monolith to modern frameworks (React, TypeScript)
Designed and maintained a scalable design system with Storybook, improving UI consistency across multiple applications
Led performance optimization initiatives, significantly improving load times and application responsiveness
Collaborated cross-functionally with Product, Design, and QA to improve accessibility and usability

work.company: Brown University – Center for Computation and Visualization
highlights: Built interactive data visualization tools and web applications in close collaboration with data scientists and research teams
Developed Honeycomb, an open-source framework for real-time psychophysiological data collection, supporting NIH BRAIN Initiative research
Implemented real-time data streaming pipelines for synchronized behavioral and neurophysiological recordings
Created D3.js-based visualizations for complex research datasets, enabling researchers to explore and analyze experimental results
Published peer-reviewed research on reproducible psychophysiological task frameworks (Nature Medicine, Brazilian Journal of Psychiatry)
